inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: upper abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting and epigastric tenderness; absence of ethanol abuse; elevated amylase level to at least twice the upper limit of normal and elevated lipase level to at lease three times the upper limit of normal; imaging confirmation of gallstones

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: three or fewer Ranson's criteria on admission: age > 55 years, glucose > 200 mg/dL , LDH> 350 mg/dL, AST > 250 units/L, and WBC>16 K/mm3; clinical stability with admission to a non-monitored ward bed

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: temperature <38.6°C, right upper quadrant pain and tenderness, and total bilirubin <4 mg/dl on admission

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: presence of three or fewer Ranson's criteria on admission

exclusion.criterion: high suspicion for retained common bile duct stone
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has gallstones and pancreatitis, but no severe pancreatitis or suspected cholangitis. She is a candidate for elective cholecystectomy.
